facts.text: New York City Football Club (NYCFC) played its first league game in the 2015 MLS season.
NYCFC is owned by City Football Group, with minority stakes held by Yankee Global Enterprises and investor Marcelo Claure.
NYCFC won the MLS Cup for the first time in 2021.
NYCFC became the first New York–based club to win an international trophy by defeating Atlas at the 2022 Campeones Cup.
NYCFC is the fifth most valuable club in MLS, worth $1 billion according to valuations by Sportico based on 2024 regular season data.
Major League Soccer announced its intent to create its 20th franchise, a second team in the New York area, in 2010.
Manchester City and the New York Yankees paid a $100 million expansion fee for NYCFC to join MLS.
NYCFC was officially announced as the 20th Major League Soccer franchise on May 21, 2013.
Claudio Reyna was named the director of football operations for New York City FC on May 22, 2013.
Jason Kreis was announced as the first head coach of New York City FC on December 11, 2013.
David Villa signed as the first player for New York City FC on June 2, 2014.
Frank Lampard joined New York City FC as their second Designated Player on July 24, 2014.
Andrea Pirlo signed as the third Designated Player for New York City FC on July 6, 2015.
New York City FC chose Oregon State forward Khiry Shelton as their first pick in the 2015 MLS SuperDraft.
Mix Diskerud scored New York City FC's first competitive goal in their first league game on March 8, 2015.
New York City FC's first home win was against New England Revolution in front of a crowd of 43,507.
New York City FC was eliminated from the 2015 Lamar Hunt U.S. Open Cup by the New York Cosmos in the fourth round.
The team finished 8th in the Eastern Conference and 17th overall in their inaugural MLS season.
Jason Kreis was relieved from his head coaching duties on November 2, 2015, after the team failed to make the playoffs.
Patrick Vieira was announced as the new head coach of New York City FC a week after Jason Kreis's release.
In 2016, under Vieira's stewardship, New York City FC qualified for the playoffs for the first time in franchise history.
David Villa became the 2016 league MVP after scoring 23 goals for New York City FC.
New York City FC finished as runners-up for the 2017 Supporters' Shield with a record of 16–9–9 and a total of 57 points.
Andrea Pirlo announced his retirement prior to New York City FC's final playoff game against Columbus Crew.
Jesus Medina became New York City's third Designated Player on New Year's Eve following the 2017 MLS season.
James Sands was promoted as New York City FC's first Homegrown Player.
Anton Tinnerholm joined New York City FC from Allsvenskan champions Malmö on December 13, following the 2017 MLS season.
Ebenezer Ofori joined New York City FC on loan from Bundesliga side VfB Stuttgart before the 2018 MLS season.
In 2018, Patrick Vieira left New York City FC to coach at Ligue 1 club Nice.
Domènec Torrent replaced Patrick Vieira as head coach of New York City FC in 2018.
Domènec Torrent secured a 2–1 win in his first game as head coach of New York City FC against Toronto on June 24, 2018.
New York City FC qualified for the playoffs as the third seed in the Eastern Conference in 2018 but were defeated in the second round.
David Villa joined J-League side Vissel Kobe after leaving New York City FC.
Alexander Ring was named the second captain of New York City FC after David Villa's departure.
New York City FC made Alexandru Mitriță their third Designated Player on February 4, for a rumored club-record transfer fee of US$9.1 million.
New York City FC finished atop the regular season standings in the Eastern Conference for the first time but were eliminated in the playoffs by Toronto.
Maxime Chanot received the Defensive Player of the Year award from New York City FC for the 2019 season.
Héber was awarded Newcomer of the Year by New York City FC for the 2019 season.
Maxi Moralez was voted into the 2019 MLS Best XI for his performances with New York City FC.
Ben Sweat was selected by Inter Miami CF as their first overall pick in the 2019 MLS Expansion Draft.
Claudio Reyna left New York City FC to join the expansion side Austin FC.
Joe Scally's transfer to Borussia Mönchengladbach was effective from January 1, 2021.
New York City FC signed Icelandic midfielder Guðmundur Þórarinsson from Swedish club Norrköping on January 28, 2020.
Ronny Deila was appointed as the head coach of New York City FC on a three-year contract starting in 2020.
New York City FC made their debut in the CONCACAF Champions League in 2020 and advanced to the quarter-finals.
New York City FC lost 1–0 away against Columbus Crew in their first match of the 2020 MLS season.
Nicolás Acevedo was signed by New York City FC from Liverpool Montevideo on March 2, 2020.
New York City FC placed third in Group A of the MLS is Back Tournament in 2020 and reached the quarter-finals.
New York City FC finished fifth in the Eastern Conference in the 2020 MLS regular season and were eliminated by Orlando City in the first round of the playoffs.
Malte Amundsen was signed by New York City FC for a reported fee of $1.6 million on February 12, 2021.
Alfredo Morales, Thiago Andrade, and Talles Magno were among the players signed by New York City FC in 2021.
New York City FC won their first MLS Cup by defeating Portland Timbers in a penalty shootout, with a final score of 4-2 in the shootout.
Valentín Castellanos won the MLS Golden Boot in the season New York City FC won their first MLS Cup, finishing with 19 goals and eight assists.
New York City FC's win in the MLS Cup was their first championship for a team from the New York region and the first New York sports franchise title since the New York Giants won Super Bowl XLVI.
The first top division soccer championship for a New York team since the New York Cosmos won the Soccer Bowl was achieved by New York City FC in their MLS Cup victory.
New York City FC's victory over New England Revolution in the Eastern Conference semi-finals marked their first MLS Playoffs win on the road and their first penalty shootout win in five attempts.
Sean Johnson saved two penalties in the MLS Cup final shootout against Portland Timbers, contributing to New York City FC's victory.
New York City FC began their playoff run by defeating Atlanta United FC 2-0 at Yankee Stadium.
In the Eastern Conference finals, New York City FC defeated the Philadelphia Union 2-1 with a late goal in the 88th minute by Talles Magno.
In the 2022 CONCACAF Champions League, New York City FC was eliminated in the semifinals by which team? Seattle Sounders.
New York City FC won their first international trophy by defeating which team in the 2022 Campeones Cup? Atlas.
Who was chosen by Charlotte FC in the 2022 MLS Expansion Draft from New York City FC and then immediately traded to Los Angeles FC? Ismael Tajouri-Shradi.
Which coach left New York City FC in June 2022 to manage Standard Liège? Ronny Delia.
Who replaced Ronny Delia as the head coach of New York City FC? Nick Cushing.
In which position did New York City FC finish in the Eastern Conference during the MLS Cup 2022 regular season? 3rd.
New York City FC was defeated by which team in the conference finals of the MLS Cup 2022? Philadelphia Union.
In which year did New York City FC announce the construction of Etihad Park along with New York City mayor Eric Adams? 2022.
Which goalkeeper was among the critical members of the 2021 championship-winning squad that left New York City FC before the 2023 campaign? Sean Johnson.
In the 2023 season, how many wins did New York City FC achieve in the stretch between April and August, across all competitions? 2 wins.
For the first time in its history, in which year did New York City FC miss the MLS Cup playoffs? 2023.
Who was fired as the head coach of New York City FC three days after their season-ending loss in the 2024 season? Nick Cushing.
Who replaced Nick Cushing as the head coach of New York City FC after the 2024 season? Pascal Jansen.
At the 2013 launch ceremony, New York City FC used a placeholder image that was a blue circle with "New York City FC" in which font? Helvetica.
Which colors did New York City FC refer to consistently, aligning with the brands of its owners Manchester City and the New York Yankees? City sky blue and Yankees navy.
New York City FC's badge design was chosen through a public vote, with over 100,000 votes cast.
The winning badge design for New York City FC, announced on March 20, was inspired by a subway token.
The club's official color scheme, announced alongside the badge options, includes navy blue, sky blue, and orange, with the orange paying homage to the city's Dutch origins.
On March 5, 2024, New York City FC announced a "refreshed" visual identity that introduced a darker shade of navy and a brighter shade of light blue.
The updated badge for New York City FC, unveiled on September 9, 2024, incorporated a new "NYC" monogram designed by Tobias Frere-Jones.
New York City FC unveiled its inaugural jersey on November 13, 2014, at Terminal 5 in Hell's Kitchen.
The club's second season away uniform featured navy blue trimmed in orange and was dominated by lighter-blue concentric circles radiating out from the logo.
New York City FC's second-ever home uniform, unveiled on January 7, 2017, paired a sky blue shirt with navy blue shorts and featured a small New York City flag on the front of the shirt.
Etihad Airways was announced as New York City FC's inaugural jersey sponsor on November 13, 2014.
New York City FC signed an agreement with WFAN for English-language radio commentary on October 3, 2013.
On December 18, 2014, New York City FC announced an agreement with the YES Network to televise all home and away games.
In 2019, Spanish-language radio station WEPN began to broadcast New York City FC games with play-by-play from Roberto Abramowitz.
From 2023, every New York City FC match is available via MLS Season Pass on the Apple TV app.
New York City FC confirmed they would play their first season home games at Yankee Stadium on April 21, 2014.
The club's initial proposal to build a soccer stadium in Flushing Meadows–Corona Park in Queens was opposed due to its park land location and objections from the New York Mets.
On August 17, 2017, the club's architects attended a site visit of Belmont Park for a potential stadium development.

The site at Belmont Park was selected by the Empire State Development Corporation for the New York Islanders' new arena on December 19, 2017, ending New York City FC's pursuit of a soccer-specific stadium at that site.

New York City FC played a home match at Pratt & Whitney Stadium at Rentschler Field in East Hartford, Connecticut, 107 miles from the city, on September 23, 2017, due to a scheduling conflict with a Yankees game.
On October 22, 2017, New York City played their final regular season home match at which venue due to a scheduling conflict with a Yankees American League Championship Series game?
Citi Field
In what year did New York City FC use Red Bull Arena for two matches of the CONCACAF Champions League because Yankee Stadium and Citi Field were undergoing winterization procedures?
How many home matches did New York City FC host at Red Bull Arena for the 2021 MLS Season due to scheduling conflicts at Yankee Stadium?
Eight
For the 2022 CONCACAF Champions League, where did New York City FC play their Round of 16 match?
Banc of California Stadium in Los Angeles, California
When did New York City and NYCFC come to an agreement to build Etihad Park, a 25,000-seat stadium in Willets Point, Queens?
November 2022
What is the name of New York City FC's official supporter group that began to form after the club's announcement in May 2013?
The Third Rail
By April 2015, how many season-ticket sales had New York City FC reached?
When was Los Templados #12 recognized as New York City FC's second official supporters group?
February 11, 2022
The first MLS league play derby between New York City FC and the New York Red Bulls took place on May 10, 2015.
The New York Red Bulls won the first encounter against New York City FC in their inaugural MLS league play derby.
The rivalry between New York City FC and the New York Red Bulls is known as the Hudson River Derby.
New York City FC eliminated the Philadelphia Union in the 2021 Eastern Conference Final.
The Philadelphia Union won against New York City FC in the 2022 Eastern Conference Final.
New York City FC won a social media contest in 2015 to have the Empire State Building lit up in their favor ahead of the Hudson River Derby on June 28.
New York City FC's official reserve squad is New York City FC II, who play in the MLS Next Pro league.
NYCFC II's home games will be played at Icahn Stadium on Randalls Island starting in 2024.
New York City FC's youth academy won its first major silverware with the U-16 team winning the Generation Adidas Cup in 2017.
The Wilmington Hammerheads were announced as New York City FC's first affiliate club on January 16, 2015.
San Antonio became an affiliate partner with New York City FC on February 9, 2017.
The MLS Cup Champions title was won in 2021.
The team was the Supporters' Shield Runners-up in both 2017 and 2019.
They were the Eastern Conference (Playoff) Champions in 2021.
The team finished as Eastern Conference (Playoff) Runners-up in 2022.
They won the Campeones Cup in 2022.
New York City Football Club (NYCFC) was launched through a partnership between Manchester City and the New York Yankees, with the expectation to begin play in 2015.
NYCFC is nicknamed "the Pigeons" by fans.
NYCFC announced their new secondary kit for the 2024 season on February 16, 2024.
NYCFC's first-ever home playoff game took place at Yankee Stadium against Toronto FC.
NYCFC will play nine matches at Yankee Stadium and six at Citi Field during the 2024 MLS Regular Season, with the venue for the last two home matches to be determined later in the year.
The overall seating capacity at Yankee Stadium was reduced by nearly 5,000 seats, from 52,325 to 47,422.
NYCFC won the MLS Cup in 2021.
NYCFC won the Campeones Cup by defeating Atlas FC 2-0.
Columbus Crew won the MLS Cup in 2020 and 2023.
The first MLS Cup was won by D.C. United in 1996.
The MLS Cup was not held in 2000.
New England Revolution won the MLS Supporters' Shield in 2002.
Toronto FC won the MLS Supporters' Shield in 2017.
The New York Red Bulls won the MLS Supporters' Shield in 2024.
Jason Kreis was the head coach of New York City FC in 2015.
Ronny Deila served as the head coach of New York City FC from 2020 to 2022.
Which team won the MLS Cup in 1996, marking the beginning of the list?
LA Galaxy
Which years was the MLS Cup not held?
How many times did LA Galaxy win the MLS Cup between 1996 and 2024?
Which team won the MLS Cup in both 2017 and 2019?
In what year did Los Angeles FC win their first MLS Cup?
Who owns 81% of Manchester City F.C.?
Abu Dhabi United Group
Which club is not part of the City Football Group's ownership?
Club Bolívar (It's listed under a different category)
What is the name of the stadium under construction in New York associated with City Football Group?
Etihad Park
Which academy is not a part of the City Football Group network?
City Football Academy (New York) (It's listed, but the correct answer format for trivia would imply listing options where one is not actually part of CFG's network)
As of the list, which club did City Football Group not have an association with in terms of youth or academy teams?
Geylang International FC (It's listed under a different category and not mentioned as having a youth or academy team associated with CFG)
In what year was New York City FC established?
Which kit manufacturer sponsored New York City FC from 2015 to 2021?
Adidas
Who has been New York City FC's shirt sponsor since the team's first season?
Etihad Airways
In which stadium has New York City FC played their home games since 2015?
Yankee Stadium
Which team played a home regular season match at Citi Field in Queens, New York, in 2017?
As of 2023, which club is part of the City Football Group?
Bahia
What was the sleeve sponsor for New York City FC in the 2022–2023 seasons?
DUDE Wipes
Which stadium did New York City FC use for a match in the U.S. Open Cup in 2016?
Coffey Field
In 2020, Sports Illustrated Stadium in Harrison, New Jersey hosted 5 home regular season matches and 2 home Champions Cup matches.
Pratt & Whitney Stadium at Rentschler Field in East Hartford, Connecticut hosted 1 home regular season match in 2017 and 1 home CONCACAF Champions Cup match in 2022.
BMO Stadium in Los Angeles, California hosted 1 home CONCACAF Champions League match in 2022.
David Villa was the top goalscorer for the 2015 MLS season with 18 goals.
In 2016, David Villa scored 23 goals, making him the top goalscorer for that MLS season.
David Villa again was the top goalscorer in the 2017 MLS season with 24 goals.
The 2021 MLS season saw Valentín Castellanos as the top goalscorer with 23 goals.
In 2022, NYCFC won the Campeones Cup.
Brad Sims has been serving as the CEO since January 1, 2019.
NYCFC finished the 2023 MLS season in 11th place in the conference and 22nd overall.
Gabriel Pereira was the top goalscorer for NYCFC in the 2023 MLS season with 6 goals.
NYCFC's average attendance throughout their seasons is 22,815.
In the 2020 CONCACAF Champions League quarterfinals, which team was defeated by UANL with an aggregate score of 0-5?
During the 2022 CONCACAF Champions League semifinals, which team did New York City FC lose to with an aggregate score of 2-4?
Who was the coach of New York City FC with the highest win percentage during their tenure up until November 2024?
Which player served as a captain of New York City FC from 2021 to 2023?
In what year did New York City FC have their highest regular season attendance, according to the data provided up until 2024?
Due to the COVID pandemic, in which year was no attendance permitted at New York City FC's games?
Who was the head coach of New York City FC immediately before Pascal Jansen?
